headline: Inside offers early access; outside may offer night drives
summary: Camps inside national parks offer immediate access at gate opening and eliminate transit time. Camps outside parks (in private conservancies or nearby) often offer activities not permitted inside: night drives, walking safaris, and off-road driving. The choice depends on which activities matter more than pure park access timing.

assumptions.text: Inside camps provide game viewing from dawn without transit time.
Private conservancies often allow night drives, walks, and off-road driving.
Wildlife in conservancies may be less dense than inside prime park areas.

gains: Inside: Immediate access at first light
Outside: Night drives and walking safaris
Outside: Often more exclusive with fewer vehicles
losses: Inside: On-road only in national parks
Outside: Transit time to park gates
Outside: Wildlife density may be lower

change_conditions: If night drives are priority, outside/private concessions are essential.
If maximum wildlife exposure matters, inside camps in prime areas.
If exclusivity is valued, private conservancies often have fewer vehicles.
If combining both, split nights between inside and private areas.
